rounds.observation:
[GAME] Welcome to the Tic Tac Toe Arena! You are competing as Player 0.
Victory is achieved by claiming three consecutive squares in any direction: horizontal, vertical, or diagonal.
To make your move, choose a numbered position (0-8) on the grid and submit it in brackets.
Example: '[7]' will claim the bottom-right corner of the board.

Your battle symbol is 'O', while your opponent fights with 'X'.

[GAME] Current Board:

 0 | 1 | 2 
---+---+---
 3 | 4 | 5 
---+---+---
 6 | 7 | 8 

Available Moves: '[0]', '[1]', '[2]', '[3]', '[4]', '[5]', '[6]', '[7]', '[8]'
rounds.response:
To start, I'll choose a position that gives me the most flexibility for my next move and also puts pressure on my opponent to respond accordingly. The center of the board is usually the most strategic starting point because it provides the greatest flexibility for the next move.

Since the current board is empty, I'll choose the center square, which is position 4.

'[4]'
